name: Descent - Berhala & Hikayat
description: ‘BERHALA’ is a Malay term meaning Idolatry, the worship of an idol as though it were God. ‘HIKAYAT’ is a term in Malay language that translate to stories, a narratives that usually perceives as myths or legends. A piece that highlights the multiple variants of the ‘writer’ that meets their end as they reached the shapeshifting temple that worshipped a false deity, called the Unseeing. A being of the ‘Others’ that is extremely cunning and manipulative. She controls they who seek her help and blessing by promising to grant their dreams in return of making a ‘contract’ and becoming her worshipper for eternity. Manipulative, ruthless and emotionless.
